   141→    intro k hk
   142→    have := pair_sum_zero k hk
   143→    linarith
   144→
   145→/-- Helper: cos(x) expressed using complex exponentials -/
   146→lemma cos_as_exp_chebyshev (x : ℝ) :
   147→    Real.cos x = ((Complex.exp (x * Complex.I) + Complex.exp (-(x * Complex.I))) / 2).re := by
   148→  rw [show (Complex.exp (↑x * Complex.I) + Complex.exp (-(↑x * Complex.I))) / 2 =
   149→    Complex.cos (x : ℂ) by
   150→    rw [Complex.cos]
   151→    congr 2
   152→    congr 1
   153→    rw [neg_mul]]
   154→  exact Complex.cos_ofReal_re x
   155→
   156→/-- Helper: binomial expansion for (e^{ix} + e^{-ix})^j -/
   157→lemma exp_add_exp_pow_chebyshev (x : ℂ) (j : ℕ) :
   158→    (Complex.exp (x * Complex.I) + Complex.exp (-(x * Complex.I))) ^ j =
   159→    ∑ r ∈ range (j + 1), (j.choose r : ℂ) * Complex.exp ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * x * Complex.I) := by
   160→  rw [Commute.add_pow (Commute.all _ _)]
   161→  apply Finset.sum_congr rfl
   162→  intro r hr
   163→  have hr_le : r ≤ j := by simp only [mem_range] at hr; omega
   164→  rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul (n := r), ← Complex.exp_nat_mul (n := j - r)]
   165→  rw [← Complex.exp_add, mul_comm]
   166→  congr 1
   167→  simp only [Nat.cast_sub hr_le]
   168→  congr 1
   169→  simp only [Int.cast_sub, Int.cast_mul, Int.cast_ofNat, Int.cast_natCast]
   170→  ring
   171→
   172→/-- Lemma 5: Express power sum of cosines at Chebyshev angles as binomial expansion.
   173→
   174→    This adapts the binomial expansion from PowerSums.lean to Chebyshev root angles.
   175→    The key difference is that angles are (2k+1)π/(2N) instead of θ + 2πk/N. -/
   176→lemma sum_cos_pow_chebyshev_binomial (N j : ℕ) (_hN : 0 < N) (_hj : 0 < j) (_hj' : j < 2 * N) :
   177→    ∑ k ∈ range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ j =
   178→    (2 : ℝ) ^ (-(j : ℤ)) * ∑ r ∈ range (j + 1), (j.choose r : ℝ) *
   179→    ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
   180→  -- Follows sum_cos_pow_eq_sum_binomial from PowerSums.lean
   181→  simp only [cos_as_exp_chebyshev]
   182→
   183→  -- Pull power inside re: (z.re)^j = (z^j).re when z is real
   184→  have h_re_pow : ∀ k, ((Complex.exp (↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I) +
   185→      Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I))) / 2).re ^ j =
   186→    (((Complex.exp (↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I) +
   187→      Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I))) / 2) ^ j).re := by
   188→    intro k
   189→    set z := (Complex.exp (↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I) +
   190→        Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I))) / 2 with z_def
   191→    have h_real : z.im = 0 := by
   192→      rw [z_def]
   193→      have h1 : (Complex.exp (↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I) +
   194→          Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I))).im = 0 := by
   195→        rw [Complex.add_im, Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_im]
   196→        have : (Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I))).im =
   197→          Real.sin (-((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) := by
   198→          rw [show -(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I) =
   199→            (↑(-((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) : ℂ) * Complex.I by
   200→            apply Complex.ext <;> simp]
   201→          exact Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_im _
   202→        rw [this, Real.sin_neg]
   203→        ring
   204→      rw [Complex.div_im, h1]
   205→      simp
   206→    have h_eq : z = (z.re : ℂ) := Complex.ext rfl h_real
   207→    calc z.re ^ j
   208→      _ = (z.re : ℂ).re ^ j := by simp
   209→      _ = ((z.re : ℂ) ^ j).re := by simp [← Complex.ofReal_pow]
   210→      _ = (z ^ j).re := by rw [← h_eq]
   211→
   212→  conv_lhs =>
   213→    arg 2
   214→    ext k
   215→    rw [h_re_pow k]
   216→  rw [← Complex.re_sum]
   217→
   218→  simp only [div_pow]
   219→
   220→  rw [show ∑ x ∈ range N, (Complex.exp (↑((2 * ↑x + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) * Complex.I) +
   221→      Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * ↑x + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) * Complex.I))) ^ j / (2 : ℂ) ^ j =
   222→    ∑ x ∈ range N, (∑ r ∈ range (j + 1), (j.choose r : ℂ) *
   223→      Complex.exp ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * ↑((2 * ↑x + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) * Complex.I)) / (2 : ℂ) ^ j by
   224→    apply Finset.sum_congr rfl
   225→    intro i _
   226→    rw [exp_add_exp_pow_chebyshev (↑((2 * ↑i + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N))) j]]
   227→
   228→  rw [← Finset.sum_div, div_eq_mul_inv, mul_comm]
   229→
   230→  rw [show ((2 : ℂ) ^ j)⁻¹ = (2 : ℂ) ^ (-(j : ℤ)) by
   231→    rw [← zpow_natCast, ← zpow_neg_one, ← zpow_mul]
   232→    norm_num]
   233→
   234→  rw [Complex.mul_re]
   235→
   236→  have h_re : ((2 : ℂ) ^ (-(j : ℤ))).re = (2 : ℝ) ^ (-(j : ℤ)) := by
   237→    have : (2 : ℂ) = (↑(2 : ℝ) : ℂ) := rfl
   238→    rw [this, ← Complex.ofReal_zpow, Complex.ofReal_re]
   239→  have h_im : ((2 : ℂ) ^ (-(j : ℤ))).im = 0 := by
   240→    have : (2 : ℂ) = (↑(2 : ℝ) : ℂ) := rfl
   241→    rw [this, ← Complex.ofReal_zpow, Complex.ofReal_im]
   242→  rw [h_re, h_im]
   243→  simp
   244→
   245→  rw [Finset.sum_comm]
   246→  apply Finset.sum_congr rfl
   247→  intro r hr
   248→  rw [← Finset.mul_sum]
   249→  congr 1
   250→
   251→  rw [← Complex.re_sum, Complex.re_sum]
   252→  apply Finset.sum_congr rfl
   253→  intro k _
   254→
   255→  -- Show exp(...).re = (exp(...).re + exp(-...).re) / 2
   256→  -- First normalize the LHS to match RHS form
   257→  have lhs_norm : (Complex.exp ((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * ((2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N)) * Complex.I)).re =
   258→      (Complex.exp ((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N) * Complex.I)).re := by
   259→    congr 1
   260→    ring_nf
   261→
   262→  rw [lhs_norm]
   263→
   264→  -- Now show: exp(m*θ*I).re = (exp(m*θ*I).re + exp(-m*θ*I).re) / 2
   265→  have h1 : (Complex.exp ((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N) * Complex.I)).re =
   266→    Real.cos ((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) := by
   267→    have : (2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N) * Complex.I =
   268→      ↑((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) * Complex.I := by
   269→      push_cast
   270→      ring
   271→    rw [this, Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re]
   272→  have h2 : (Complex.exp (-((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N) * Complex.I))).re =
   273→    Real.cos ((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) := by
   274→    have : -((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N) * Complex.I) =
   275→      ↑(-((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N))) * Complex.I := by
   276→      push_cast
   277→      ring
   278→    rw [this, Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re, Real.cos_neg]
   279→  rw [h1, h2]
   280→  ring
   281→
   282→/-- Lemma 5b: Sum of cosines at Chebyshev angles vanishes for non-zero even frequencies.
   283→
   284→    For even m with 0 < m < N, the sum vanishes using complex exponentials and geometric sums.
   285→    The key insight: m even means we can write m = 2s and use geometric sum of N-th roots. -/
   286→lemma sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_even_vanishes (N m : ℕ)
   287→    (hN : 0 < N) (hm : 0 < m) (hm_even : Even m) (hm_bound : m < N) :
   288→    ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos (m * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
   289→  -- Extract s from m = 2s
   290→  obtain ⟨s, hs⟩ := hm_even
   291→  rw [hs]
   292→
   293→  -- Bound on s
   294→  have hs_pos : 0 < s := by omega
   295→  have hs_bound : s < N := by omega
   296→
   297→  -- First convert s + s to 2 * s
   298→  conv_lhs => arg 2; ext k; arg 1; rw [show (s + s : ℕ) = 2 * s by omega]
   299→
   300→  -- Push down the cast and simplify
   301→  conv_lhs => arg 2; ext k; arg 1; rw [show ((2 * s : ℕ) : ℝ) = 2 * (s : ℝ) by norm_cast]
   302→
   303→  -- Simplify 2s * (2k+1) * π / (2N) = s * (2k+1) * π / N
   304→  conv_lhs => arg 2; ext k; arg 1; rw [show (2 * (s : ℝ)) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) =
   305→      (s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N by field_simp]
   306→
   307→  -- Now prove: ∑ k, cos(s*(2k+1)*π/N) = 0 using complex exponentials
   308→  -- First prove the complex exponential sum is zero
   309→  have geom_sum_zero : ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp ((s * k : ℕ) * (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) = 0 := by
   310→    -- Let ω = exp(2πi/N), primitive N-th root
   311→    let ω := Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)
   312→    have ω_prim : IsPrimitiveRoot ω N := Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp N (by omega)
   313→
   314→    -- Rewrite as sum of powers of ω^s
   315→    have h_rewrite : ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp ((s * k : ℕ) * (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) =
   316→        ∑ k ∈ range N, ω ^ (s * k) := by
   317→      refine Finset.sum_congr rfl fun k _ => ?_
   318→      rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
   319→    rw [h_rewrite]
   320→
   321→    conv_lhs =>
   322→      arg 2
   323→      ext k
   324→      rw [pow_mul]
   325→
   326→    -- Show ω^s ≠ 1
   327→    have ωs_ne_one : ω ^ s ≠ 1 := by
   328→      intro h_eq
   329→      have h_div : N ∣ s := (ω_prim.pow_eq_one_iff_dvd s).mp h_eq
   330→      have : N ≤ s := Nat.le_of_dvd hs_pos h_div
   331→      omega
   332→
   333→    -- Show (ω^s)^N = 1
   334→    have ωs_pow_N : (ω ^ s) ^ N = 1 := by
   335→      rw [← pow_mul, mul_comm, pow_mul, ω_prim.pow_eq_one, one_pow]
   336→
   337→    -- Geometric sum
   338→    have h_geom : (ω ^ s - 1) * ∑ k ∈ range N, (ω ^ s) ^ k = (ω ^ s) ^ N - 1 :=
   339→      mul_geom_sum (ω ^ s) N
   340→    rw [ωs_pow_N] at h_geom
   341→    have : (ω ^ s - 1) * ∑ k ∈ range N, (ω ^ s) ^ k = 0 := by
   342→      rw [h_geom]; ring
   343→    exact eq_zero_of_ne_zero_of_mul_left_eq_zero (sub_ne_zero_of_ne ωs_ne_one) this
   344→
   345→  have complex_sum :
   346→      ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N)) = 0 := by
   347→    -- Factor: s*(2k+1)*π/N = s*π/N + s*2k*π/N
   348→    calc ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N))
   349→        = ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (s : ℝ) * π / N) *
   350→            Complex.exp (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k) * π / N)) := by
   351→          refine Finset.sum_congr rfl fun k _ => ?_
   352→          rw [← Complex.exp_add]
   353→          congr 1
   354→          push_cast
   355→          ring
   356→      _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * (s : ℝ) * π / N) *
   357→            ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k) * π / N)) := by
   358→          rw [Finset.mul_sum]
   359→      _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * (s : ℝ) * π / N) *
   360→            ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp ((s * k : ℕ) * (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) := by
   361→          congr 2
   362→          funext k
   363→          congr 1
   364→          push_cast
   365→          ring
   366→      _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * (s : ℝ) * π / N) * 0 := by rw [geom_sum_zero]
   367→      _ = 0 := by simp
   368→
   369→  -- Convert cosine to exponential and use complex_sum
   370→  have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N) =
   371→      (Complex.exp (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N))).re := by
   372→    intro k
   373→    have h1 : (Complex.I * (((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N) : ℂ)) =
   374→        ((((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N) : ℝ) : ℂ) * Complex.I := by
   375→      push_cast
   376→      ring
   377→    rw [show (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N) : ℂ) =
   378→        Complex.I * (((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N) : ℂ) by push_cast; rfl]
   379→    rw [h1]
   380→    exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
   381→
   382→  simp_rw [cos_eq]
   383→  rw [← Complex.re_sum, complex_sum]
   384→  simp
   385→
   386→/-- Lemma 6: All non-constant binomial terms vanish for Chebyshev angles.
   387→
   388→    This shows that when (2r - j) ≠ 0, the sum of cosines vanishes because:
   389→    1. (2r - j) is odd (when non-zero and j odd) OR even (when j even)
   390→    2. |2r - j| < 2N (from the bounds on j and r)
   391→    3. Apply the appropriate vanishing lemma -/
   392→lemma binomial_terms_vanish_chebyshev (N j r : ℕ) (hN : 0 < N) (hj' : j < N)
   393→    (hr : r ∈ range (j + 1)) (hr_neq : (2 * r - j : ℤ) ≠ 0) :
   394→    ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
   395→  -- We need to show:
   396→  -- 1. (2r - j) is odd
   397→  -- 2. |2r - j| < 2N
   398→  -- Then apply sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_vanishes
   399→
   400→  -- First establish the bound: r ≤ j
   401→  have hr_le : r ≤ j := by
   402→    simp only [mem_range] at hr
   403→    omega
   404→
   405→  -- Split by parity of j
   406→  by_cases h_parity : Odd j
   407→  · -- Case 1: j is odd, so (2r - j) is odd
   408→    have h_odd : Odd (2 * r - j : ℤ) := by
   409→      obtain ⟨m, hm⟩ := h_parity
   410→      use (r : ℤ) - m - 1
   411→      have : (j : ℤ) = 2 * m + 1 := by exact_mod_cast hm
   412→      calc (2 * r - j : ℤ)
   413→        _ = 2 * (r : ℤ) - (2 * m + 1) := by rw [this]
   414→        _ = 2 * ((r : ℤ) - m - 1) + 1 := by ring
   415→
   416→    -- Prove |2r - j| < 2N
   417→    have h_bound : |(2 * r - j : ℤ)| < 2 * N := by
   418→      by_cases hr_case : 2 * r ≥ j
   419→      · rw [abs_of_nonneg (Int.sub_nonneg_of_le (by omega : (j : ℤ) ≤ (2 * r : ℤ)))]
   420→        calc (2 * r - j : ℤ)
   421→          _ ≤ (2 * j - j : ℤ) := by omega
   422→          _ = (j : ℤ) := by ring
   423→          _ < (N : ℤ) := by omega
   424→          _ < (2 * N : ℤ) := by omega
   425→      · push_neg at hr_case
   426→        rw [abs_of_neg (Int.sub_neg_of_lt (by omega : (2 * r : ℤ) < (j : ℤ)))]
   427→        calc -(2 * r - j : ℤ)
   428→          _ = (j - 2 * r : ℤ) := by ring
   429→          _ ≤ (j : ℤ) := by omega
   430→          _ < (N : ℤ) := by omega
   431→          _ < (2 * N : ℤ) := by omega
   432→
   433→    -- Apply odd vanishing lemma
   434→    convert sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_vanishes N (2 * r - j) hN hr_neq h_odd h_bound using 2
   435→
   436→  · -- Case 2: j is even, so (2r - j) is even
   437→    have j_even : Even j := Nat.not_odd_iff_even.mp h_parity
   438→    have h_even : Even (2 * r - j : ℤ) := by
   439→      obtain ⟨m, hm⟩ := j_even
   440→      use (r : ℤ) - m
   441→      have : (j : ℤ) = (m + m : ℕ) := by simp [hm]
   442→      calc (2 * r - j : ℤ)
   443→        _ = 2 * (r : ℤ) - ((m : ℤ) + (m : ℤ)) := by rw [this]; simp
   444→        _ = 2 * (r : ℤ) - 2 * (m : ℤ) := by ring
   445→        _ = ((r : ℤ) - (m : ℤ)) + ((r : ℤ) - (m : ℤ)) := by ring
   446→
   447→    -- Convert to natural number case
   448→    -- Need to handle both positive and negative cases of (2r - j)
   449→    by_cases h_sign : 2 * r ≥ j
   450→    · -- Positive case: 2r - j ≥ 0
   451→      have h_pos : 0 ≤ (2 * r - j : ℤ) := Int.sub_nonneg_of_le (by omega : (j : ℤ) ≤ (2 * r : ℤ))
   452→      obtain ⟨m_nat, hm_nat⟩ := Int.eq_ofNat_of_zero_le h_pos
   453→
   454→      -- Show m_nat is even and bounded
   455→      have hm_even : Even m_nat := by
   456→        have := h_even
   457→        rwa [hm_nat, Int.even_coe_nat] at this
   458→
   459→      have hm_pos : 0 < m_nat := by
   460→        by_contra h
   461→        push_neg at h
   462→        have : m_nat = 0 := by omega
   463→        rw [this] at hm_nat
   464→        simp at hm_nat
   465→        omega
   466→
   467→      have hm_bound : m_nat < N := by
   468→        have : (m_nat : ℤ) < N := by
   469→          calc (m_nat : ℤ)
   470→            _ = 2 * r - j := by rw [← hm_nat]
   471→            _ ≤ 2 * j - j := by omega
   472→            _ = j := by ring
   473→            _ < N := by omega
   474→        omega
   475→
   476→      -- Apply even vanishing lemma
   477→      calc ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))
   478→          _ = ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((m_nat : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
   479→              congr 1; ext k; congr 1
   480→              rw [hm_nat]
   481→              norm_cast
   482→          _ = 0 := sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_even_vanishes N m_nat hN hm_pos hm_even hm_bound
   483→
   484→    · -- Negative case: 2r - j < 0, use cos(-x) = cos(x)
   485→      have h_neg : (2 * r - j : ℤ) < 0 := Int.sub_neg_of_lt (by omega : (2 * r : ℤ) < (j : ℤ))
   486→      have h_pos : 0 < -(2 * r - j : ℤ) := by omega
   487→
   488→      obtain ⟨m_nat, hm_nat⟩ := Int.eq_ofNat_of_zero_le (by omega : 0 ≤ -(2 * r - j : ℤ))
   489→
   490→      -- Show m_nat is even and bounded
   491→      have hm_even : Even m_nat := by
   492→        have : Even (-(2 * r - j : ℤ)) := by
   493→          obtain ⟨k, hk⟩ := h_even
   494→          use -k
   495→          calc -(2 * r - j : ℤ)
   496→            _ = -(k + k) := by rw [hk]
   497→            _ = -k + -k := by ring
   498→        rwa [hm_nat, Int.even_coe_nat] at this
   499→
   500→      have hm_pos : 0 < m_nat := by
   501→        have : (m_nat : ℤ) ≠ 0 := by
   502→          intro h
   503→          rw [h] at hm_nat
   504→          simp at hm_nat
   505→          omega
   506→        omega
   507→
   508→      have hm_bound : m_nat < N := by
   509→        have : (m_nat : ℤ) < N := by
   510→          calc (m_nat : ℤ)
   511→            _ = -(2 * r - j) := by rw [← hm_nat]
   512→            _ = j - 2 * r := by ring
   513→            _ ≤ j := by omega
   514→            _ < N := by omega
   515→        omega
   516→
   517→      -- Apply even vanishing lemma with cos(-x) = cos(x)
   518→      calc ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))
   519→          _ = ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((-(m_nat : ℤ)) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
   520→              congr 1; ext k; congr 1
   521→              have : (2 * r - j : ℤ) = -(m_nat : ℤ) := by rw [← hm_nat]; ring
   522→              rw [this]
   523→              norm_cast
   524→          _ = ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((m_nat : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
   525→              congr 1; ext k
   526→              have : ((-(m_nat : ℤ)) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) : ℝ) =
   527→                  -((m_nat : ℤ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
   528→                push_cast; ring
   529→              rw [this, Real.cos_neg]
   530→              norm_cast
   531→          _ = 0 := sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_even_vanishes N m_nat hN hm_pos hm_even hm_bound
   532→
   533→end ChebyshevCircles
   534→
   535→end

/-

Authors: Eric, Claude Code

Discrete orthogonality for Chebyshev root angles.

Proves that sums of cosines at Chebyshev angles vanish for non-zero frequencies,
which is the key property needed to extend the binomial expansion proof technique
from rotated roots to Chebyshev roots.
-/

import Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Trigonometric.Complex
import Mathlib.NumberTheory.Cyclotomic.PrimitiveRoots
import Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.Exponential
import ChebyshevCircles.TrigonometricIdentities
import ChebyshevCircles.PowerSums

noncomputable section
open Complex Real Finset

namespace ChebyshevCircles

/-- Sum of exponentials at Chebyshev angles can be factored into a geometric sum. -/
lemma sum_exp_chebyshev_angles (N m : ℕ) :
    ∑ k ∈ range N, exp ((2 * k + 1 : ℂ) * m * π * I / (2 * N)) =
    exp (m * π * I / (2 * N)) * ∑ k ∈ range N, exp (k * m * π * I / N) := by
  -- Factor out exp(mπi/(2N)) from each term
  -- (2k+1) * m * π/(2N) = m*π/(2N) + k * m * π/N
  conv_lhs => arg 2; ext k; rw [show (2 * k + 1 : ℂ) * m * π * I / (2 * N) =
      m * π * I / (2 * N) + k * m * π * I / N by
    field_simp
    ring]
  simp_rw [Complex.exp_add, Finset.mul_sum]

/-- Sum of cosines at Chebyshev angles vanishes for non-zero odd frequencies.

    Proof strategy: Chebyshev angles satisfy θ_k + θ_{N-1-k} = π.
    For odd m, cos(m·θ_{N-1-k}) = cos(m·(π - θ_k)) = -cos(m·θ_k).
    Terms pair up and cancel via the involution k ↦ N-1-k. -/
lemma sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_vanishes (N : ℕ) (m : ℤ) (hN : 0 < N)
    (hm : m ≠ 0) (hm_odd : Odd m) (hm_bound : |m| < 2 * N) :
    ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos (m * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
  -- Define the term we're summing
  let f : ℕ → ℝ := fun k ↦ Real.cos (m * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))

  -- We'll show the sum vanishes by pairing terms using symmetry
  -- Key observation: θ_k + θ_{N-1-k} = (2k+1)π/(2N) + (2(N-1-k)+1)π/(2N) = π

  -- First, prove the pairing lemma: f(k) + f(N-1-k) = 0
  have pair_sum_zero : ∀ k ∈ range N, f k + f (N - 1 - k) = 0 := by
    intro k hk
    simp only [f]
    rw [mem_range] at hk
    have hk_le : k ≤ N - 1 := Nat.le_pred_of_lt hk

    -- First establish the cast identity for (N - 1 - k)
    have cast_eq : ((N - 1 - k) : ℝ) = N - 1 - k := by
      rfl

    -- The key insight: (2*(N-1-k)+1)*π/(2N) + (2*k+1)*π/(2N) = π
    -- So cos(m * first_angle) = cos(m*(π - second_angle)) = (-1)^m * cos(m*second_angle)

    -- Simplify the angle for N-1-k
    have angle_identity : (2 * (N - 1 - k : ℝ) + 1) * π /
      (2 * N) + (2 * k + 1) * π / (2 * N) = π := by
      have h2N_ne : (2 * N : ℝ) ≠ 0 := by
        have : (0 : ℝ) < N := Nat.cast_pos.mpr hN
        linarith
      rw [← add_div, ← add_mul]
      -- Show the sum of coefficients equals 2N
      have coeff_sum : 2 * (N - 1 - k : ℝ) + 1 + (2 * k + 1) = 2 * N := by
        have : (2 * (N - 1 - k) + 1 : ℕ) + (2 * k + 1) = 2 * N := by omega
        linarith
      rw [coeff_sum]
      field_simp

    -- Rewrite second angle as π minus first angle
    have second_angle : (2 * (N - 1 - k : ℝ) + 1) * π / (2 * N) =
      π - (2 * k + 1) * π / (2 * N) := by
      linarith [angle_identity]

    -- Substitute and use cosine identity
    -- Need to show the second cosine argument can be rewritten
    have key : m * (2 * ((N - 1 - k) : ℝ) + 1) * π / (2 * N) =
      m * (π - (2 * k + 1) * π / (2 * N)) := by
      calc m * (2 * (N - 1 - k : ℝ) + 1) * π / (2 * N)
          = m * ((2 * (N - 1 - k : ℝ) + 1) * π / (2 * N)) := by ring
        _ = m * (π - (2 * k + 1) * π / (2 * N)) := by rw [second_angle]

    -- Rewrite the goal to use the same casting as key
    have cast_adjust : (2 * ↑(N - 1 - k) + 1 : ℝ) = 2 * (↑N - 1 - ↑k) + 1 := by
      congr 1
      have : k ≤ N - 1 := hk_le
      rw [Nat.cast_sub this, Nat.cast_sub (Nat.one_le_of_lt hN)]
      simp
    rw [cast_adjust, key, mul_sub, Real.cos_int_mul_pi_sub]

    -- For odd m, (-1)^m = -1
    have neg_one_pow : (-1 : ℝ) ^ m = -1 := by
      obtain ⟨k, rfl⟩ := hm_odd
      rw [zpow_add₀ (by norm_num : (-1 : ℝ) ≠ 0)]
      rw [zpow_mul, zpow_ofNat]
      norm_num

    rw [neg_one_pow]
    ring_nf

  -- Apply the sum involution: terms pair up and cancel
  -- We use the fact that g(k) = N-1-k is an involution and f(k) + f(g(k)) = 0

  -- The sum equals its own negation, hence it must be zero
  suffices h : ∑ k ∈ range N, f k = -∑ k ∈ range N, f k by
    linarith [h]

  -- Reindex the sum using the involution k ↦ N - 1 - k
  rw [← Finset.sum_neg_distrib]
  refine Finset.sum_bij (fun k _ => N - 1 - k) ?_ ?_ ?_ ?_
  · -- Prove ∀ k ∈ range N, N - 1 - k ∈ range N
    intro k hk
    simp [mem_range] at hk ⊢
    omega
  · -- Prove injectivity
    intro a₁ ha₁ a₂ ha₂ heq
    simp only at heq
    have h1 : a₁ < N := by simp [mem_range] at ha₁; exact ha₁
    have h2 : a₂ < N := by simp [mem_range] at ha₂; exact ha₂
    -- N - 1 - a₁ = N - 1 - a₂ implies a₁ = a₂
    omega
  · -- Prove surjectivity
    intro b hb
    use N - 1 - b
    refine ⟨?_, ?_⟩
    · simp [mem_range] at hb ⊢
      have : b < N := hb
      omega
    · simp only
      have : b < N := by simp [mem_range] at hb; exact hb
      omega
  · -- Prove ∀ k ∈ range N, -f k = f (N - 1 - k)
    intro k hk
    have := pair_sum_zero k hk
    linarith

/-- Helper: cos(x) expressed using complex exponentials -/
lemma cos_as_exp_chebyshev (x : ℝ) :
    Real.cos x = ((Complex.exp (x * Complex.I) + Complex.exp (-(x * Complex.I))) / 2).re := by
  rw [show (Complex.exp (↑x * Complex.I) + Complex.exp (-(↑x * Complex.I))) / 2 =
    Complex.cos (x : ℂ) by
    rw [Complex.cos]
    congr 2
    congr 1
    rw [neg_mul]]
  exact Complex.cos_ofReal_re x

/-- Helper: binomial expansion for (e^{ix} + e^{-ix})^j -/
lemma exp_add_exp_pow_chebyshev (x : ℂ) (j : ℕ) :
    (Complex.exp (x * Complex.I) + Complex.exp (-(x * Complex.I))) ^ j =
    ∑ r ∈ range (j + 1), (j.choose r : ℂ) * Complex.exp ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * x * Complex.I) := by
  rw [Commute.add_pow (Commute.all _ _)]
  apply Finset.sum_congr rfl
  intro r hr
  have hr_le : r ≤ j := by simp only [mem_range] at hr; omega
  rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul (n := r), ← Complex.exp_nat_mul (n := j - r)]
  rw [← Complex.exp_add, mul_comm]
  congr 1
  simp only [Nat.cast_sub hr_le]
  congr 1
  simp only [Int.cast_sub, Int.cast_mul, Int.cast_ofNat, Int.cast_natCast]
  ring

/-- Lemma 5: Express power sum of cosines at Chebyshev angles as binomial expansion.

    This adapts the binomial expansion from PowerSums.lean to Chebyshev root angles.
    The key difference is that angles are (2k+1)π/(2N) instead of θ + 2πk/N. -/
lemma sum_cos_pow_chebyshev_binomial (N j : ℕ) (_hN : 0 < N) (_hj : 0 < j) (_hj' : j < 2 * N) :
    ∑ k ∈ range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ j =
    (2 : ℝ) ^ (-(j : ℤ)) * ∑ r ∈ range (j + 1), (j.choose r : ℝ) *
    ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
  -- Follows sum_cos_pow_eq_sum_binomial from PowerSums.lean
  simp only [cos_as_exp_chebyshev]

  -- Pull power inside re: (z.re)^j = (z^j).re when z is real
  have h_re_pow : ∀ k, ((Complex.exp (↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I) +
      Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I))) / 2).re ^ j =
    (((Complex.exp (↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I) +
      Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I))) / 2) ^ j).re := by
    intro k
    set z := (Complex.exp (↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I) +
        Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I))) / 2 with z_def
    have h_real : z.im = 0 := by
      rw [z_def]
      have h1 : (Complex.exp (↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I) +
          Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I))).im = 0 := by
        rw [Complex.add_im, Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_im]
        have : (Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I))).im =
          Real.sin (-((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) := by
          rw [show -(↑((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) * Complex.I) =
            (↑(-((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) : ℂ) * Complex.I by
            apply Complex.ext <;> simp]
          exact Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_im _
        rw [this, Real.sin_neg]
        ring
      rw [Complex.div_im, h1]
      simp
    have h_eq : z = (z.re : ℂ) := Complex.ext rfl h_real
    calc z.re ^ j
      _ = (z.re : ℂ).re ^ j := by simp
      _ = ((z.re : ℂ) ^ j).re := by simp [← Complex.ofReal_pow]
      _ = (z ^ j).re := by rw [← h_eq]

  conv_lhs =>
    arg 2
    ext k
    rw [h_re_pow k]
  rw [← Complex.re_sum]

  simp only [div_pow]

  rw [show ∑ x ∈ range N, (Complex.exp (↑((2 * ↑x + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) * Complex.I) +
      Complex.exp (-(↑((2 * ↑x + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) * Complex.I))) ^ j / (2 : ℂ) ^ j =
    ∑ x ∈ range N, (∑ r ∈ range (j + 1), (j.choose r : ℂ) *
      Complex.exp ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * ↑((2 * ↑x + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) * Complex.I)) / (2 : ℂ) ^ j by
    apply Finset.sum_congr rfl
    intro i _
    rw [exp_add_exp_pow_chebyshev (↑((2 * ↑i + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N))) j]]

  rw [← Finset.sum_div, div_eq_mul_inv, mul_comm]

  rw [show ((2 : ℂ) ^ j)⁻¹ = (2 : ℂ) ^ (-(j : ℤ)) by
    rw [← zpow_natCast, ← zpow_neg_one, ← zpow_mul]
    norm_num]

  rw [Complex.mul_re]

  have h_re : ((2 : ℂ) ^ (-(j : ℤ))).re = (2 : ℝ) ^ (-(j : ℤ)) := by
    have : (2 : ℂ) = (↑(2 : ℝ) : ℂ) := rfl
    rw [this, ← Complex.ofReal_zpow, Complex.ofReal_re]
  have h_im : ((2 : ℂ) ^ (-(j : ℤ))).im = 0 := by
    have : (2 : ℂ) = (↑(2 : ℝ) : ℂ) := rfl
    rw [this, ← Complex.ofReal_zpow, Complex.ofReal_im]
  rw [h_re, h_im]
  simp

  rw [Finset.sum_comm]
  apply Finset.sum_congr rfl
  intro r hr
  rw [← Finset.mul_sum]
  congr 1

  rw [← Complex.re_sum, Complex.re_sum]
  apply Finset.sum_congr rfl
  intro k _

  -- Show exp(...).re = (exp(...).re + exp(-...).re) / 2
  -- First normalize the LHS to match RHS form
  have lhs_norm : (Complex.exp ((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * ((2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N)) * Complex.I)).re =
      (Complex.exp ((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N) * Complex.I)).re := by
    congr 1
    ring_nf

  rw [lhs_norm]

  -- Now show: exp(m*θ*I).re = (exp(m*θ*I).re + exp(-m*θ*I).re) / 2
  have h1 : (Complex.exp ((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N) * Complex.I)).re =
    Real.cos ((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) := by
    have : (2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N) * Complex.I =
      ↑((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) * Complex.I := by
      push_cast
      ring
    rw [this, Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re]
  have h2 : (Complex.exp (-((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N) * Complex.I))).re =
    Real.cos ((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N)) := by
    have : -((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * ↑π / (2 * ↑N) * Complex.I) =
      ↑(-((2 * ↑r - ↑j) * (2 * ↑k + 1) * π / (2 * ↑N))) * Complex.I := by
      push_cast
      ring
    rw [this, Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re, Real.cos_neg]
  rw [h1, h2]
  ring

/-- Lemma 5b: Sum of cosines at Chebyshev angles vanishes for non-zero even frequencies.

    For even m with 0 < m < N, the sum vanishes using complex exponentials and geometric sums.
    The key insight: m even means we can write m = 2s and use geometric sum of N-th roots. -/
lemma sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_even_vanishes (N m : ℕ)
    (hN : 0 < N) (hm : 0 < m) (hm_even : Even m) (hm_bound : m < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos (m * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
  -- Extract s from m = 2s
  obtain ⟨s, hs⟩ := hm_even
  rw [hs]

  -- Bound on s
  have hs_pos : 0 < s := by omega
  have hs_bound : s < N := by omega

  -- First convert s + s to 2 * s
  conv_lhs => arg 2; ext k; arg 1; rw [show (s + s : ℕ) = 2 * s by omega]

  -- Push down the cast and simplify
  conv_lhs => arg 2; ext k; arg 1; rw [show ((2 * s : ℕ) : ℝ) = 2 * (s : ℝ) by norm_cast]

  -- Simplify 2s * (2k+1) * π / (2N) = s * (2k+1) * π / N
  conv_lhs => arg 2; ext k; arg 1; rw [show (2 * (s : ℝ)) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) =
      (s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N by field_simp]

  -- Now prove: ∑ k, cos(s*(2k+1)*π/N) = 0 using complex exponentials
  -- First prove the complex exponential sum is zero
  have geom_sum_zero : ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp ((s * k : ℕ) * (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) = 0 := by
    -- Let ω = exp(2πi/N), primitive N-th root
    let ω := Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)
    have ω_prim : IsPrimitiveRoot ω N := Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp N (by omega)

    -- Rewrite as sum of powers of ω^s
    have h_rewrite : ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp ((s * k : ℕ) * (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) =
        ∑ k ∈ range N, ω ^ (s * k) := by
      refine Finset.sum_congr rfl fun k _ => ?_
      rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
    rw [h_rewrite]

    conv_lhs =>
      arg 2
      ext k
      rw [pow_mul]

    -- Show ω^s ≠ 1
    have ωs_ne_one : ω ^ s ≠ 1 := by
      intro h_eq
      have h_div : N ∣ s := (ω_prim.pow_eq_one_iff_dvd s).mp h_eq
      have : N ≤ s := Nat.le_of_dvd hs_pos h_div
      omega

    -- Show (ω^s)^N = 1
    have ωs_pow_N : (ω ^ s) ^ N = 1 := by
      rw [← pow_mul, mul_comm, pow_mul, ω_prim.pow_eq_one, one_pow]

    -- Geometric sum
    have h_geom : (ω ^ s - 1) * ∑ k ∈ range N, (ω ^ s) ^ k = (ω ^ s) ^ N - 1 :=
      mul_geom_sum (ω ^ s) N
    rw [ωs_pow_N] at h_geom
    have : (ω ^ s - 1) * ∑ k ∈ range N, (ω ^ s) ^ k = 0 := by
      rw [h_geom]; ring
    exact eq_zero_of_ne_zero_of_mul_left_eq_zero (sub_ne_zero_of_ne ωs_ne_one) this

  have complex_sum :
      ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N)) = 0 := by
    -- Factor: s*(2k+1)*π/N = s*π/N + s*2k*π/N
    calc ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N))
        = ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (s : ℝ) * π / N) *
            Complex.exp (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k) * π / N)) := by
          refine Finset.sum_congr rfl fun k _ => ?_
          rw [← Complex.exp_add]
          congr 1
          push_cast
          ring
      _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * (s : ℝ) * π / N) *
            ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k) * π / N)) := by
          rw [Finset.mul_sum]
      _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * (s : ℝ) * π / N) *
            ∑ k ∈ range N, Complex.exp ((s * k : ℕ) * (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) := by
          congr 2
          funext k
          congr 1
          push_cast
          ring
      _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * (s : ℝ) * π / N) * 0 := by rw [geom_sum_zero]
      _ = 0 := by simp

  -- Convert cosine to exponential and use complex_sum
  have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N) =
      (Complex.exp (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N))).re := by
    intro k
    have h1 : (Complex.I * (((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N) : ℂ)) =
        ((((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N) : ℝ) : ℂ) * Complex.I := by
      push_cast
      ring
    rw [show (Complex.I * ((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N) : ℂ) =
        Complex.I * (((s : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1) * π / N) : ℂ) by push_cast; rfl]
    rw [h1]
    exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm

  simp_rw [cos_eq]
  rw [← Complex.re_sum, complex_sum]
  simp

/-- Lemma 6: All non-constant binomial terms vanish for Chebyshev angles.

    This shows that when (2r - j) ≠ 0, the sum of cosines vanishes because:
    1. (2r - j) is odd (when non-zero and j odd) OR even (when j even)
    2. |2r - j| < 2N (from the bounds on j and r)
    3. Apply the appropriate vanishing lemma -/
lemma binomial_terms_vanish_chebyshev (N j r : ℕ) (hN : 0 < N) (hj' : j < N)
    (hr : r ∈ range (j + 1)) (hr_neq : (2 * r - j : ℤ) ≠ 0) :
    ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
  -- We need to show:
  -- 1. (2r - j) is odd
  -- 2. |2r - j| < 2N
  -- Then apply sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_vanishes

  -- First establish the bound: r ≤ j
  have hr_le : r ≤ j := by
    simp only [mem_range] at hr
    omega

  -- Split by parity of j
  by_cases h_parity : Odd j
  · -- Case 1: j is odd, so (2r - j) is odd
    have h_odd : Odd (2 * r - j : ℤ) := by
      obtain ⟨m, hm⟩ := h_parity
      use (r : ℤ) - m - 1
      have : (j : ℤ) = 2 * m + 1 := by exact_mod_cast hm
      calc (2 * r - j : ℤ)
        _ = 2 * (r : ℤ) - (2 * m + 1) := by rw [this]
        _ = 2 * ((r : ℤ) - m - 1) + 1 := by ring

    -- Prove |2r - j| < 2N
    have h_bound : |(2 * r - j : ℤ)| < 2 * N := by
      by_cases hr_case : 2 * r ≥ j
      · rw [abs_of_nonneg (Int.sub_nonneg_of_le (by omega : (j : ℤ) ≤ (2 * r : ℤ)))]
        calc (2 * r - j : ℤ)
          _ ≤ (2 * j - j : ℤ) := by omega
          _ = (j : ℤ) := by ring
          _ < (N : ℤ) := by omega
          _ < (2 * N : ℤ) := by omega
      · push_neg at hr_case
        rw [abs_of_neg (Int.sub_neg_of_lt (by omega : (2 * r : ℤ) < (j : ℤ)))]
        calc -(2 * r - j : ℤ)
          _ = (j - 2 * r : ℤ) := by ring
          _ ≤ (j : ℤ) := by omega
          _ < (N : ℤ) := by omega
          _ < (2 * N : ℤ) := by omega

    -- Apply odd vanishing lemma
    convert sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_vanishes N (2 * r - j) hN hr_neq h_odd h_bound using 2

  · -- Case 2: j is even, so (2r - j) is even
    have j_even : Even j := Nat.not_odd_iff_even.mp h_parity
    have h_even : Even (2 * r - j : ℤ) := by
      obtain ⟨m, hm⟩ := j_even
      use (r : ℤ) - m
      have : (j : ℤ) = (m + m : ℕ) := by simp [hm]
      calc (2 * r - j : ℤ)
        _ = 2 * (r : ℤ) - ((m : ℤ) + (m : ℤ)) := by rw [this]; simp
        _ = 2 * (r : ℤ) - 2 * (m : ℤ) := by ring
        _ = ((r : ℤ) - (m : ℤ)) + ((r : ℤ) - (m : ℤ)) := by ring

    -- Convert to natural number case
    -- Need to handle both positive and negative cases of (2r - j)
    by_cases h_sign : 2 * r ≥ j
    · -- Positive case: 2r - j ≥ 0
      have h_pos : 0 ≤ (2 * r - j : ℤ) := Int.sub_nonneg_of_le (by omega : (j : ℤ) ≤ (2 * r : ℤ))
      obtain ⟨m_nat, hm_nat⟩ := Int.eq_ofNat_of_zero_le h_pos

      -- Show m_nat is even and bounded
      have hm_even : Even m_nat := by
        have := h_even
        rwa [hm_nat, Int.even_coe_nat] at this

      have hm_pos : 0 < m_nat := by
        by_contra h
        push_neg at h
        have : m_nat = 0 := by omega
        rw [this] at hm_nat
        simp at hm_nat
        omega

      have hm_bound : m_nat < N := by
        have : (m_nat : ℤ) < N := by
          calc (m_nat : ℤ)
            _ = 2 * r - j := by rw [← hm_nat]
            _ ≤ 2 * j - j := by omega
            _ = j := by ring
            _ < N := by omega
        omega

      -- Apply even vanishing lemma
      calc ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))
          _ = ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((m_nat : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
              congr 1; ext k; congr 1
              rw [hm_nat]
              norm_cast
          _ = 0 := sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_even_vanishes N m_nat hN hm_pos hm_even hm_bound

    · -- Negative case: 2r - j < 0, use cos(-x) = cos(x)
      have h_neg : (2 * r - j : ℤ) < 0 := Int.sub_neg_of_lt (by omega : (2 * r : ℤ) < (j : ℤ))
      have h_pos : 0 < -(2 * r - j : ℤ) := by omega

      obtain ⟨m_nat, hm_nat⟩ := Int.eq_ofNat_of_zero_le (by omega : 0 ≤ -(2 * r - j : ℤ))

      -- Show m_nat is even and bounded
      have hm_even : Even m_nat := by
        have : Even (-(2 * r - j : ℤ)) := by
          obtain ⟨k, hk⟩ := h_even
          use -k
          calc -(2 * r - j : ℤ)
            _ = -(k + k) := by rw [hk]
            _ = -k + -k := by ring
        rwa [hm_nat, Int.even_coe_nat] at this

      have hm_pos : 0 < m_nat := by
        have : (m_nat : ℤ) ≠ 0 := by
          intro h
          rw [h] at hm_nat
          simp at hm_nat
          omega
        omega

      have hm_bound : m_nat < N := by
        have : (m_nat : ℤ) < N := by
          calc (m_nat : ℤ)
            _ = -(2 * r - j) := by rw [← hm_nat]
            _ = j - 2 * r := by ring
            _ ≤ j := by omega
            _ < N := by omega
        omega

      -- Apply even vanishing lemma with cos(-x) = cos(x)
      calc ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((2 * r - j : ℤ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))
          _ = ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((-(m_nat : ℤ)) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
              congr 1; ext k; congr 1
              have : (2 * r - j : ℤ) = -(m_nat : ℤ) := by rw [← hm_nat]; ring
              rw [this]
              norm_cast
          _ = ∑ k ∈ range N, Real.cos ((m_nat : ℝ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
              congr 1; ext k
              have : ((-(m_nat : ℤ)) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) : ℝ) =
                  -((m_nat : ℤ) * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
                push_cast; ring
              rw [this, Real.cos_neg]
              norm_cast
          _ = 0 := sum_cos_chebyshev_angles_even_vanishes N m_nat hN hm_pos hm_even hm_bound

end ChebyshevCircles

    12→
    13→/-!
    14→# Polynomial Construction from Rotated Roots
    15→
    16→This file constructs polynomials from the real projections of rotated roots of unity.
    17→The key construction is the scaled polynomial that will be shown to equal a Chebyshev
    18→polynomial of the first kind plus a constant.
    19→
    20→## Main definitions
    21→
    22→* `polynomialFromRealRoots`: Build a polynomial from a list of real roots
    23→* `scaledPolynomial`: The polynomial from rotated roots, scaled by 2^(N-1)
    24→
    25→## Main results
    26→
    27→* Degree and coefficient properties of the constructed polynomials
    28→
    29→## Tags
    30→
    31→Chebyshev polynomials, polynomial construction, roots
    32→-/
    33→
    34→noncomputable section
    35→
    36→open Polynomial
    37→open scoped Polynomial
    38→
    39→variable {R : Type*} [CommRing R]
    40→
    41→/-- Construct a monic polynomial from a list of real roots using the product formula. -/
    42→def polynomialFromRealRoots (roots : List ℝ) : Polynomial ℝ :=
    43→  roots.foldr (fun r p => (X - C r) * p) 1
    44→
    45→/-- The unscaled polynomial constructed from N rotated roots of unity projected to the real axis. -/
    46→def unscaledPolynomial (N : ℕ) (θ : ℝ) : Polynomial ℝ :=
    47→  polynomialFromRealRoots (realProjectionsList N θ)
    48→
    49→/-- The scaled polynomial: multiply by 2^(N-1) to match Chebyshev normalization. -/
    50→def scaledPolynomial (N : ℕ) (θ : ℝ) : Polynomial ℝ :=
    51→  C (2 ^ (N - 1)) * unscaledPolynomial N θ
    52→
    53→/-- Evaluating a polynomial constructed from roots at one of those roots gives zero. -/
    54→theorem polynomialFromRealRoots_eval_mem (roots : List ℝ) (r : ℝ) (hr : r ∈ roots) :
    55→    (polynomialFromRealRoots roots).eval r = 0 := by
    56→  induction roots with
    57→  | nil => simp at hr
    58→  | cons r' rs ih =>
    59→    unfold polynomialFromRealRoots
    60→    simp only [List.foldr, eval_mul]
    61→    cases List.mem_cons.mp hr with
    62→    | inl h =>
    63→      rw [h]
    64→      simp [eval_sub, eval_X, eval_C]
    65→    | inr h =>
    66→      simp only [mul_eq_zero]
    67→      right
    68→      exact ih h
    69→
    70→/-- Degree of polynomial from list of roots equals list length. -/
    71→theorem polynomialFromRealRoots_degree (roots : List ℝ) :
    72→    (polynomialFromRealRoots roots).degree = roots.length := by
    73→  induction roots with
    74→  | nil => simp [polynomialFromRealRoots]
    75→  | cons r rs ih =>
    76→    unfold polynomialFromRealRoots at ih ⊢
    77→    simp only [List.foldr, List.length_cons]
    78→    rw [degree_mul, degree_X_sub_C, ih]
    79→    norm_cast
    80→    ring
    81→
    82→/-- The unscaled polynomial has degree N. -/
    83→theorem unscaledPolynomial_degree (N : ℕ) (θ : ℝ) :
    84→    (unscaledPolynomial N θ).degree = N := by
    85→  unfold unscaledPolynomial
    86→  rw [polynomialFromRealRoots_degree, card_realProjectionsList]
    87→
    88→/-- The scaled polynomial has degree N. -/
    89→theorem scaledPolynomial_degree (N : ℕ) (θ : ℝ) (_hN : 0 < N) :
    90→    (scaledPolynomial N θ).degree = N := by
    91→  unfold scaledPolynomial
    92→  rw [degree_C_mul, unscaledPolynomial_degree N θ]
    93→  exact pow_ne_zero (N - 1) two_ne_zero
    94→
    95→/-- The unscaled polynomial is monic (leading coefficient is 1). -/
    96→theorem unscaledPolynomial_monic (N : ℕ) (θ : ℝ) :
    97→    (unscaledPolynomial N θ).leadingCoeff = 1 := by
    98→  unfold unscaledPolynomial polynomialFromRealRoots
    99→  induction (realProjectionsList N θ) with
   100→  | nil => simp [List.foldr]
   101→  | cons r rs ih =>
   102→    simp only [List.foldr]
   103→    rw [leadingCoeff_mul, leadingCoeff_X_sub_C, ih, mul_one]
   104→
   105→/-- The leading coefficient of the scaled polynomial. -/
   106→theorem scaledPolynomial_leadingCoeff (N : ℕ) (θ : ℝ) :
   107→    (scaledPolynomial N θ).leadingCoeff = 2 ^ (N - 1) := by
   108→  unfold scaledPolynomial
   109→  rw [leadingCoeff_mul, leadingCoeff_C, unscaledPolynomial_monic, mul_one]
   110→
   111→/-- Extract the coefficient of X^k from the scaled polynomial. -/
   112→def scaledPolynomial_coeff (N : ℕ) (θ : ℝ) (k : ℕ) : ℝ :=
   113→  (scaledPolynomial N θ).coeff k
   114→
   115→/-- If a polynomial from real roots evaluates to 0 at 0, then 0 is in the list of roots. -/
   116→lemma polynomialFromRealRoots_eval_zero_iff_mem_zero (roots : List ℝ) :
   117→    (polynomialFromRealRoots roots).eval 0 = 0 ↔ 0 ∈ roots := by
   118→  induction roots with
   119→  | nil => simp [polynomialFromRealRoots]
   120→  | cons r rs ih =>
   121→    unfold polynomialFromRealRoots
   122→    simp only [List.foldr, eval_mul, List.mem_cons]
   123→    rw [mul_eq_zero]
   124→    constructor
   125→    · intro h
   126→      cases h with
   127→      | inl h =>
   128→        simp [eval_sub, eval_X, eval_C] at h
   129→        left; linarith
   130→      | inr h =>
   131→        right
   132→        exact ih.mp h
   133→    · intro h
   134→      cases h with
   135→      | inl h =>
   136→        left
   137→        simp [eval_sub, eval_X, eval_C, h]
   138→      | inr h =>
   139→        right
   140→        exact ih.mpr h
   141→
   142→/-- The value cos(θ + 2πk/N) for k=0 equals cos(θ). -/
   143→lemma realProjectionsList_mem_cos_theta (N : ℕ) (θ : ℝ) (hN : 0 < N) :
   144→    Real.cos θ ∈ realProjectionsList N θ := by
   145→  unfold realProjectionsList
   146→  simp only [List.mem_map, List.mem_range]
   147→  use 0
   148→  exact ⟨hN, by simp⟩
   149→
   150→lemma cos_two_pi_k_div_odd_N_ne_zero (N k : ℕ) (hN_odd : Odd N) (hN_ge : N ≥ 5)
   151→    (_hk_pos : 0 < k) (hk_lt : k < N) :
   152→    Real.cos (2 * Real.pi * k / N) ≠ 0 := by
   153→  intro h
   154→  rw [Real.cos_eq_zero_iff] at h
   155→  obtain ⟨m, hm⟩ := h
   156→  have eq_real : (4 : ℝ) * k = N * (2 * m + 1) := by
   157→    have h3 := congr_arg (· * (2 * N / Real.pi)) hm
   158→    field_simp at h3; linarith
   159→  obtain ⟨n, rfl⟩ := hN_odd
   160→  have eq_int : (4 * k : ℤ) = (2 * (n : ℤ) + 1) * (2 * m + 1) := by
   161→    have h1 : (4 * k : ℝ) = ((2 * n + 1 : ℕ) : ℝ) * (2 * (m : ℤ) + 1) := by
   162→      convert eq_real using 2
   163→    have h2 : ((2 * n + 1 : ℕ) : ℝ) = ((2 * (n : ℤ) + 1) : ℝ) := by norm_cast
   164→    have h3 : (4 * k : ℝ) = ((2 * (n : ℤ) + 1) * (2 * m + 1) : ℤ) := by
   165→      calc (4 * k : ℝ) = ((2 * n + 1 : ℕ) : ℝ) * (2 * (m : ℤ) + 1) := h1
   166→        _ = ((2 * (n : ℤ) + 1) : ℝ) * (2 * m + 1) := by rw [h2]
   167→        _ = ((2 * (n : ℤ) + 1) * (2 * m + 1) : ℤ) := by norm_cast
   168→    exact_mod_cast h3
   169→  have h_expand : (2 * (n : ℤ) + 1) * (2 * m + 1) = 2 * (2 * n * m + n + m) + 1 := by ring
   170→  rw [h_expand] at eq_int
   171→  have h_even : Even (4 * k : ℤ) := ⟨2 * k, by ring⟩
   172→  have h_odd : Odd (2 * (2 * (n : ℤ) * m + n + m) + 1) := ⟨2 * n * m + n + m, rfl⟩
   173→  rw [← eq_int] at h_odd
   174→  exact Int.not_even_iff_odd.mpr h_odd h_even
   175→
   176→/-- If N is odd and k ∈ (0, N), then cos(2πk/N) ≠ 0. -/
   177→lemma realProjectionsList_theta_zero_no_zero (N : ℕ) (hN_odd : Odd N) (hN_ge : N ≥ 5) :
   178→    0 ∉ realProjectionsList N 0 := by
   179→  unfold realProjectionsList
   180→  simp only [List.mem_map, not_exists, not_and, List.mem_range]
   181→  intro k hk
   182→  simp only [zero_add]
   183→  by_cases h_zero : k = 0
   184→  · rw [h_zero]
   185→    simp [Real.cos_zero]
   186→  · have hk_pos : 0 < k := Nat.pos_of_ne_zero h_zero
   187→    exact cos_two_pi_k_div_odd_N_ne_zero N k hN_odd hN_ge hk_pos hk
   188→
   189→/-- The constant term of the scaled polynomial depends on θ. -/

   191→    ∃ θ₁ θ₂ : ℝ, scaledPolynomial_coeff N θ₁ 0 ≠ scaledPolynomial_coeff N θ₂ 0 := by

   204→      unfold scaledPolynomial_coeff scaledPolynomial unscaledPolynomial polynomialFromRealRoots
   205→      rw [Polynomial.coeff_C_mul, Polynomial.coeff_C_mul]
   206→      simp only [realProjectionsList]

   385→              have h_range : List.range 6 = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5] := by rfl
   386→              simp only [h_range]
   387→              norm_num [Real.cos_zero, Real.cos_pi, Real.cos_pi_div_two]
   388→              -- Need to show ¬cos(2πk/6) = 0 for k = 1,2,3,4,5
   389→              -- cos(2πk/6) = cos(πk/3)
   390→              -- k=1: cos(π/3) = 1/2 ≠ 0
   391→              -- k=2: cos(2π/3) = -1/2 ≠ 0
   392→              -- k=3: cos(π) = -1 ≠ 0
   393→              -- k=4: cos(4π/3) = -1/2 ≠ 0
   394→              -- k=5: cos(5π/3) = 1/2 ≠ 0
   395→              constructor
   396→              · intro h
   397→                -- cos(2π/6) = cos(π/3) = 1/2 ≠ 0
   398→                have h1 : Real.cos (2 * Real.pi / 6) = Real.cos (Real.pi / 3) := by
   399→                  congr 1; field_simp; ring
   400→                have h2 : Real.cos (Real.pi / 3) = 1 / 2 := by norm_num
   401→                rw [h1, h2] at h
   402→                norm_num at h
   403→              · constructor
   404→                · intro h
   405→                  have h1 : Real.cos (2 * Real.pi * 2 / 6) = Real.cos (2 * Real.pi / 3) := by
   406→                    congr 1; field_simp; ring
   407→                  rw [h1] at h
   408→                  -- cos(2π/3) = cos(π - π/3) = -cos(π/3) = -1/2
   409→                  have h2 : Real.cos (2 * Real.pi / 3) = -Real.cos (Real.pi / 3) := by
   410→                    have : 2 * Real.pi / 3 = Real.pi - Real.pi / 3 := by field_simp; ring
   411→                    rw [this, Real.cos_pi_sub]
   412→                  have h3 : Real.cos (Real.pi / 3) = 1 / 2 := by norm_num
   413→                  rw [h2, h3] at h
   414→                  norm_num at h
   415→                · constructor
   416→                  · intro h
   417→                    have h1 : Real.cos (2 * Real.pi * 3 / 6) = Real.cos Real.pi := by
   418→                      congr 1; field_simp; ring
   419→                    rw [h1, Real.cos_pi] at h
   420→                    norm_num at h
   421→                  · constructor
   422→                    · intro h
   423→                      have h1 : Real.cos (2 * Real.pi * 4 / 6) = Real.cos (4 * Real.pi / 3) := by
   424→                        congr 1; field_simp; ring
   425→                      rw [h1] at h
   426→                      -- cos(4π/3) = cos(π/3 + π) = -cos(π/3) = -1/2
   427→                      have h2 : Real.cos (4 * Real.pi / 3) = -Real.cos (Real.pi / 3) := by
   428→                        have : 4 * Real.pi / 3 = Real.pi / 3 + Real.pi := by field_simp; ring
   429→                        rw [this, Real.cos_add_pi]
   430→                      have h3 : Real.cos (Real.pi / 3) = 1 / 2 := by norm_num
   431→                      rw [h2, h3] at h
   432→                      norm_num at h
   433→                    · intro h
   434→                      have h1 : Real.cos (2 * Real.pi * 5 / 6) = Real.cos (5 * Real.pi / 3) := by
   435→                        congr 1; field_simp; ring
   436→                      rw [h1] at h
   437→                      -- cos(5π/3) = cos(2π - π/3) = cos(π/3) = 1/2
   438→                      have h2 : Real.cos (5 * Real.pi / 3) = Real.cos (Real.pi / 3) := by
   439→                        have : 5 * Real.pi / 3 = 2 * Real.pi - Real.pi / 3 := by field_simp; ring
   440→                        rw [this, Real.cos_two_pi_sub]
   441→                      have h3 : Real.cos (Real.pi / 3) = 1 / 2 := by norm_num
   442→                      rw [h2, h3] at h
   443→                      norm_num at h
   444→            | succ n7 =>
   445→              -- N = (n7 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1).succ = n7 + 7 ≥ 7
   446→              have N_eq : (n7 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 1).succ = n7 + 7 := by omega
   447→              by_cases h_odd : Odd (n7 + 7)
   448→              · -- Odd N ≥ 7: use θ=0 and θ=π/2
   449→                use 0, Real.pi / 2
   450→                unfold scaledPolynomial_coeff scaledPolynomial unscaledPolynomial
   451→                rw [Polynomial.coeff_C_mul, Polynomial.coeff_C_mul]
   452→                rw [N_eq]
   453→                intro h_eq
   454→                -- At θ=π/2, constant term is 0 because cos(π/2) = 0
   455→                have h_right : (polynomialFromRealRoots (realProjectionsList (n7 + 7) (Real.pi / 2))).coeff 0 = 0 := by
   456→                  rw [coeff_zero_eq_eval_zero, polynomialFromRealRoots_eval_zero_iff_mem_zero]
   457→                  have h_mem := realProjectionsList_mem_cos_theta (n7 + 7) (Real.pi / 2) (by omega : 0 < n7 + 7)
   458→                  rw [Real.cos_pi_div_two] at h_mem
   459→                  exact h_mem
   460→                -- At θ=0, constant term is nonzero
   461→                have h_left : (polynomialFromRealRoots (realProjectionsList (n7 + 7) 0)).coeff 0 ≠ 0 := by
   462→                  intro h_zero
   463→                  rw [coeff_zero_eq_eval_zero, polynomialFromRealRoots_eval_zero_iff_mem_zero] at h_zero
   464→                  exact realProjectionsList_theta_zero_no_zero (n7 + 7) h_odd (by omega) h_zero
   465→                -- This contradicts the equality
   466→                have h1 : 2 ^ (n7 + 7 - 1) * (polynomialFromRealRoots (realProjectionsList (n7 + 7) 0)).coeff 0 =
   467→                    2 ^ (n7 + 7 - 1) * (polynomialFromRealRoots (realProjectionsList (n7 + 7) (Real.pi / 2))).coeff 0 := h_eq
   468→                rw [h_right, mul_zero] at h1
   469→                have h_pow : (2 : ℝ) ^ (n7 + 7 - 1) ≠ 0 := pow_ne_zero _ (by norm_num)
   470→                exact h_left (mul_eq_zero.mp h1 |>.resolve_left h_pow)
   471→              · -- Even N ≥ 7: use θ = π/(2N) and θ = π/2
   472→                -- At θ = π/2, the constant term is 0
   473→                -- At θ = π/(2N), the constant term is nonzero (proof deferred to sorry)
   474→                use Real.pi / (2 * (n7 + 7)), Real.pi / 2
   475→                unfold scaledPolynomial_coeff scaledPolynomial unscaledPolynomial
   476→                rw [Polynomial.coeff_C_mul, Polynomial.coeff_C_mul]
   477→                rw [N_eq]
   478→                intro h_eq
   479→                -- At θ=π/2, constant term is 0 because cos(π/2) = 0
   480→                have h_right : (polynomialFromRealRoots (realProjectionsList (n7 + 7) (Real.pi / 2))).coeff 0 = 0 := by
   481→                  rw [coeff_zero_eq_eval_zero, polynomialFromRealRoots_eval_zero_iff_mem_zero]
   482→                  have h_mem := realProjectionsList_mem_cos_theta (n7 + 7) (Real.pi / 2) (by omega : 0 < n7 + 7)
   483→                  rw [Real.cos_pi_div_two] at h_mem
   484→                  exact h_mem
   485→                -- At θ=π/(2N), constant term is nonzero
   486→                -- This requires showing that cos(π/(2N) + 2πk/N) ≠ 0 for all k ∈ [0,N)
   487→                have h_left : (polynomialFromRealRoots (realProjectionsList (n7 + 7) (Real.pi / (2 * (n7 + 7))))).coeff 0 ≠ 0 := by
   488→                  intro h_zero
   489→                  rw [coeff_zero_eq_eval_zero, polynomialFromRealRoots_eval_zero_iff_mem_zero] at h_zero
   490→                  -- 0 ∈ realProjectionsList means ∃k, cos(π/(2N) + 2πk/N) = 0
   491→                  unfold realProjectionsList at h_zero
   492→                  simp only [List.mem_map, List.mem_range] at h_zero
   493→                  obtain ⟨k, hk_range, hk_eq⟩ := h_zero
   494→                  -- Now hk_eq : cos(π/(2N) + 2πk/N) = 0 and k < n7 + 7
   495→                  -- cos(x) = 0 iff x = (2m + 1)π/2 for some integer m
   496→                  rw [Real.cos_eq_zero_iff] at hk_eq
   497→                  obtain ⟨m, hm⟩ := hk_eq
   498→                  -- hm: π/(2N) + 2πk/N = (2m+1)π/2
   499→                  -- Multiply both sides by 2(n7+7)/π
   500→                  have h_mul := congr_arg (· * (2 * (n7 + 7) / Real.pi)) hm
   501→                  field_simp at h_mul
   502→                  -- h_mul: ↑(n7 + 7) + 2 ^ 2 * (↑n7 + 7) * ↑k = (↑n7 + 7) * ↑(n7 + 7) * (2 * ↑m + 1)
   503→                  -- Simplify to: 1 + 4k = (n7 + 7) * (2m + 1)
   504→                  have h_n7_ne_zero : ((n7 + 7) : ℝ) ≠ 0 := by positivity
   505→                  have eq_real : (1 : ℝ) + 4 * k = (n7 + 7) * (2 * m + 1) := by
   506→                    -- h_mul has form: ↑(n7 + 7) + 2^2 * (↑n7 + 7) * ↑k = ...
   507→                    -- First normalize the cast issue: ↑(n7 + 7) = ↑n7 + 7
   508→                    have cast_eq : (↑(n7 + 7) : ℝ) = ↑n7 + 7 := by norm_cast
   509→                    rw [cast_eq] at h_mul
   510→                    -- Now h_mul: (↑n7 + 7) + 2^2 * (↑n7 + 7) * ↑k = (↑n7 + 7) * (↑n7 + 7) * (2m+1)
   511→                    -- Factor LHS
   512→                    have h_lhs : (↑n7 + 7 : ℝ) + 2 ^ 2 * (↑n7 + 7) * ↑k = (↑n7 + 7) * (1 + 4 * k) := by ring
   513→                    rw [h_lhs] at h_mul
   514→                    -- Now h_mul: (↑n7 + 7) * (1 + 4 * k) = (↑n7 + 7) * (↑n7 + 7) * (2m+1)
   515→                    -- Reassociate RHS
   516→                    have h_rhs : (↑n7 + 7 : ℝ) * (↑n7 + 7) * (2 * ↑m + 1) = (↑n7 + 7) * ((↑n7 + 7) * (2 * m + 1)) := by ring
   517→                    rw [h_rhs] at h_mul
   518→                    have h_n7_ne_zero' : (↑n7 + 7 : ℝ) ≠ 0 := by positivity
   519→                    exact mul_left_cancel₀ h_n7_ne_zero' h_mul
   520→                  -- Since ¬Odd (n7 + 7), we have Even (n7 + 7)
   521→                  have h_even_nat : Even (n7 + 7) := by
   522→                    cases Nat.even_or_odd (n7 + 7) with
   523→                    | inl h => exact h
   524→                    | inr h => exact absurd h h_odd
   525→                  obtain ⟨n, hn⟩ := h_even_nat
   526→                  -- So 1 + 4k = 2n(2m + 1), which is even
   527→                  -- First, convert hn to a real equality
   528→                  have hn_real : (n7 + 7 : ℝ) = (n + n : ℝ) := by exact_mod_cast hn
   529→                  have eq_int : (1 + 4 * k : ℤ) = (2 * (n : ℤ)) * (2 * m + 1) := by
   530→                    -- Substitute hn_real into eq_real
   531→                    rw [hn_real] at eq_real
   532→                    have h_two_n : (n + n : ℝ) = (2 * n : ℝ) := by ring
   533→                    rw [h_two_n] at eq_real
   534→                    -- Now eq_real : 1 + 4 * k = 2 * n * (2 * m + 1)
   535→                    -- Convert to integer equality
   536→                    have h_cast : (1 : ℝ) + 4 * k = ((2 * (n : ℤ)) * (2 * m + 1) : ℝ) := by
   537→                      convert eq_real using 1
   538→                    exact_mod_cast h_cast
   539→                  -- The RHS is even
   540→                  have h_rhs_even : Even ((2 * (n : ℤ)) * (2 * m + 1)) := ⟨n * (2 * m + 1), by ring⟩
   541→                  -- But the LHS is odd
   542→                  have h_lhs_odd : Odd (1 + 4 * (k : ℤ)) := ⟨2 * k, by ring⟩
   543→                  -- Contradiction
   544→                  rw [eq_int] at h_lhs_odd
   545→                  exact Int.not_even_iff_odd.mpr h_lhs_odd h_rhs_even
   546→                -- This contradicts the equality
   547→                have h1 : 2 ^ (n7 + 7 - 1) * (polynomialFromRealRoots (realProjectionsList (n7 + 7) (Real.pi / (2 * (n7 + 7))))).coeff 0 =
   548→                    2 ^ (n7 + 7 - 1) * (polynomialFromRealRoots (realProjectionsList (n7 + 7) (Real.pi / 2))).coeff 0 := h_eq
   549→                rw [h_right, mul_zero] at h1
   550→                have h_pow : (2 : ℝ) ^ (n7 + 7 - 1) ≠ 0 := pow_ne_zero _ (by norm_num)
   551→                exact h_left (mul_eq_zero.mp h1 |>.resolve_left h_pow)
   552→
   553→end
   554→
